intro: Pterichis leucoptera, commonly known as the white-leaf pterichis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
